# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/rich/themes.py
@source-hash: d318132e8cdf69b7
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:00:03Z

## Primary Purpose
Provides a centralized theme configuration module for the Rich library, establishing the default theme used for text styling and formatting.

## Key Components
- **DEFAULT_STYLES import (L1)**: Imports the base style definitions from the default_styles module
- **Theme import (L2)**: Imports the Theme class from the theme module  
- **DEFAULT theme instance (L5)**: Creates the primary default theme object by instantiating Theme with DEFAULT_STYLES

## Architecture
This module serves as a simple factory/configuration point that combines the default style definitions with the Theme class to create a ready-to-use default theme instance. The pattern separates style data (DEFAULT_STYLES) from the theme container class (Theme), allowing for clean modularity.

## Dependencies
- `default_styles` module: Provides the DEFAULT_STYLES configuration
- `theme` module: Provides the Theme class implementation

## Usage Pattern
The DEFAULT theme instance is likely consumed by other Rich components as the fallback styling configuration when no custom theme is specified.
